result.execSummary:
The defendant Brodrick Allen Meyers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brodrick Allen Meyers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brodrick Allen Meyers was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with concurrent Probation.
Defendant will be on Probation until December 7, 2018.
Defendant to report to Probation today July 24, 2018.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Barry Curtis Lundeen   DF:  Brodrick Allen Meyers appeared. Case called at 10:13 a.m. Court notes all files are set for a pre trial conference. 16CM170 is set for a motion to revoke DJOC. 18TR1302, a NG plea is entered. Atty Lundeen has just been retained. Requesting matters be reset and 16CM170 be set in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 15, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
to Revoke DA filed by DA Michael Nieskes (to kes). eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  Barry Curtis Lundeen  DF: Brodrick Allen Meyers appeared. Case called at 9:30. Includes 16CM170, 17CF130. Atty. Lundeen recites agreement. DA Nieskes responds.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads  NC  to Ct 6 removing the domestic abuse enhancer in 17CF130 and pleads NC to Ct. 7 in 17CF130. DE enters a plea  of G to a TR that will be filed,  following too closely 346.14. DE agrees to extend the Diversion Agreement for another 6 months today from today's date. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 6 removing the domestic abuse enhancer and 7 in  17CF130. Court finds the DE guilty of the TR that will be filed ff of $250.00 taken from bond on file. Court will extend the Diversion agreement in 16CM170 for an additional 6 months to expire on 06-07-2018. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct  1, 2, 3, 4, 5 in 17CF130. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H.
On Ct. 6
1 year probation with conditions:
- Costs of $243.00.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
  Apply bond on file. 
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Alexis B or minor child L A B.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Derick H. or  residence within 500 yards.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Any other programming recommended by the agent.  



On Ct. 7
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Costs of $243.00.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
Apply bond on file and return any remainder to the payor. 

Court reserves on expungement upon successful completion of probation and application by DE.

Lundeen updates the Court as to missed DRC reporting. DA Nieskes requests a urine ETG test today.  Court will not order any further testing today as DE tested yesterday. Jury trial scheduled for December 6, 2017 at 08:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Brodrick Allen Meyers appeared.  Court called at 11:19 a.m. Set for Plea/Sentencing.  Includes case 15CM631, 15CM665, 16CM26 & 16CM170.  Attorney Kucinski recites the agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CM631 to Cty Ord. 52.  Court questions the DE.  DE pleads No Contest to Cty Ord. 52.  Court finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Cty Ord. 52.    Court orders costs only of $114.50.  DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan.     

Court proceeds with sentencing on 16CM170.  State files a 6 month Diversion Agreement with the Court.  Crt reviews the plea questionnaire and informs the DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 in 16CM170.  Crt reviews the police reports.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and stays the adjudication of guilt pending the full performance of the Diversion Agreement. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM170 & 15CM665 & 16CM26.  Court questions the DE.  Court approves the Diversion agreement and signs the Order.  Court adjourned.  lw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Brodrick Allen Meyers appeared.  Court called at 11:32 a.m.  Includes case 15CM631, 15CM665, 16CM26 & 16CM170.  DE is working on getting into counseling.  Human services has no openings at this time.   DE is working on obtaining fulltime employment.  Bail is continued.  Continue the PTC.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 21, 2016 at 11:30 am.

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE is ordered to counseling 

- DE to become fully employed or be enrolled in school

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Alexis B. D/O/B 07/04/1997.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF:  Brodrick Allen Meyers appeared from jail.
